page.title: 11Didbrook in 1985.
page.content: {Didbrook}is a village consisting of 37 dwellings which are a mixture of rented council or{Estate}houses and private houses. In all there are 7 detached houses, 18 semi-detached houses, 4 semi-detached bungalows, 7 terraced houses and 1 farm. There is also a church and a primary school. There are no shops in the village and the only regular deliveries are of milk. No newspapers are delivered. 84 people live in the village; 40 of these are women over the age of 18; 27 are men over 18 and 17 are children. Only a handful of the men are employed on the farms or the Estate. Others are retired, self employed, or travel as far as Cheltenham or Tewkesbury to work. Castleways of Winchcombe operate a bus service 3 times a day.
